intro: Alangium maliliense var. maliliense, commonly known as the Malili alangium, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and glossy, while the flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in natural habitats.
